pr_title: Changefeed - Created an interface and put implementation details in implementation

timeline.message: Created an interface and put implementation details in implementation

timeline.bodyText: Should I call this ...EventImpl? Analyze Step is mad at me for keeping the same name
timeline.author: gapra-msft

timeline.bodyText:
all of this could be
static <T> T nullOr(String name, Object o, Class<T> clazz)

See https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/extra/generics/methods.html
timeline.author: kasobol-msft

timeline.bodyText:
we should mark all methods coming from interface with @Override (so that compiler can catch changes).
See https://stackoverflow.com/questions/212614/should-we-override-an-interfaces-method-implementation
We can also use {@inheritDoc} to not repeat javadocs.
This applies to other places so I won't repeat this there.
timeline.author: kasobol-msft

replies.bodyText: Another fun note is Javadoc will walk the hierarchy tree if a method is annotated with @Override and doesn't have Javadocs to use parent Javadocs (won't use them if the parent class is Object).
replies.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: @alzimmermsft There's a rule in checkstyle to catch Override thing - could you guys enable it ?
replies.author: kasobol-msft

replies.bodyText: Should be easy to add, I'll file an issue for this as it may trigger a lot of new exceptions.
replies.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: If these are used across various models then they should exist in separate class. For example ChangeFeedModelValidator or something like that.
timeline.author: kasobol-msft

timeline.bodyText: Mind adding @Override to the implementation methods.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Should these static helpers go into a separate utility class? These may be related to BlobChangefeedEvent but they also feel very standalone.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.message: Added new class for model type validation
